pageTitle: Itinerary for Friday, September 1, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Friday, September 1, 2017:

Saskatoon, Saskatchewan

9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister and the Minister of Employment, Workforce Development and Labour, Patricia Hajdu, will deliver remarks to recognize Eid al-Adha.

Prairieland Park
503 Ruth Street

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage for remarks
  • Media should arrive no later than 8:30 a.m.

10:00 a.m. The Prime Minister and the Minister of Employment, Workforce Development and Labour will meet with the Saskatoon Tribal Council.

White Buffalo Youth Lodge
602 20th Street

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting
  • Media should arrive no later than 9:45 a.m.

1:15 p.m. The Prime Minister and the Minister of Employment, Workforce Development and Labour will participate in a roundtable discussion with co-op students.  A media availability will follow.

Gordon Oaks Red Bear Student Centre
University of Saskatchewan
5 Campus Drive

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the roundtable and open coverage for media availability
  • Media should arrive no later than 12:45 p.m. and present themselves to Meeting Room 130

Whitehorse, Yukon

6:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a community event with the Member of Parliament for Yukon, Larry Bagnell.

River Side Patio
Kwanlin DÃ¼n Cultural Centre
1171-1st Avenue

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 6:00 p.m.

Note: all times local
